model_solution:
Step 1: We will use the definition of factorial to simplify the expression: $\frac{42!}{40!}=\frac{42\cdot 41\cdot 40!}{40!}$
Step 2: Cancel out the common factor of 40! in the numerator and denominator.
Step 3: $42\cdot 41$
$42\cdot 41=1,742$
Step 4: $42\cdot 41=1,742$
Step 5: $\frac{42\cdot 41}{1}=1,742$
Step 6: $\frac{42\cdot 41}{1}=1,742$
Step 7: 1,742
Step 8: 1742
Step 9: 1742
steps: Step 1: We will use the definition of factorial to simplify the expression: $\frac{42!}{40!}=\frac{42\cdot 41\cdot 40!}{40!}$
Step 2: Cancel out the common factor of 40! in the numerator and denominator.
full_steps: Step 1: We will use the definition of factorial to simplify the expression: $\frac{42!}{40!}=\frac{42\cdot 41\cdot 40!}{40!}$
Step 2: Cancel out the common factor of 40! in the numerator and denominator.
